definition: as many as the hair of the ox (idiom)/great amount of/countless
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
as/as if/such as
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
surname Niu

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
surname Mao

sentences.english: Bad managers are a dime a dozen but a good one is difficult to find.
sentences.chinese: 壞的老闆簡直是多如牛毛，碰見一個好的真難。

sentences.english: I used to live in an area where criminals abounded and where the legal system seemed powerless.
sentences.chinese: 我曾住在一個罪犯多如牛毛而法律又軟弱的地區。

sentences.english: There are countless enterprises in europe.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲的商業企業多如牛毛。

sentences.english: Plus a rash of other women-focused product sale sites.
sentences.chinese: 而且這種專注於女性產品的購物網站現在多如牛毛。

sentences.english: However, the vast number of extensions available for Firefox can be a bit overwhelming.
sentences.chinese: 然而，多如牛毛的火狐擴展會讓用戶感到無所適從。

sentences.english: There are so many software companies out there.
sentences.chinese: 現在軟件公司多如牛毛。

sentences.english: In addition, they were forced to pay innumerable surtaxes , to say nothing of the government land tax.
sentences.chinese: 除了田賦以外，他們還被迫交納多如牛毛的各種雜捐。

definition: too many to count (idiom); innumerable
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
can be found everywhere
lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
one can't tell how many/numerous similar cases
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
lit. measured in cartloads and gallons/fig. by the barrowload (i.e. lots and lots)/innumerable
countless/innumerable
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
in great abundance/numerous
too numerous to mention individually or one by one
very few/very little
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
many and varied/of many different kinds
too numerous to list (idiom); innumerable
there are plenty of such people
